events.title: Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
events.description: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife Sophie are assassinated in Sarajevo by Gavrilo Princip, a Bosnian Serb nationalist. This event triggers the chain of events leading to World War I.

events.title: Austria-Hungary Declares War on Serbia
events.description: Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia, marking the official start of World War I.

events.title: Germany Declares War on Russia
events.description: Germany declares war on Russia, expanding the conflict. Germany also begins mobilization against France.

events.title: Germany Declares War on France
events.description: Germany declares war on France and begins invasion through Belgium, triggering British entry into the war.

events.title: Britain Declares War on Germany
events.description: Britain declares war on Germany following the invasion of neutral Belgium, bringing the British Empire into the conflict.

events.title: World War I
events.description: The Great War: a global conflict primarily fought in Europe, involving the Allied Powers against the Central Powers.

events.title: Battle of Tannenberg
events.description: German forces decisively defeat the Russian Second Army in East Prussia, killing or capturing over 150,000 Russian soldiers.

events.title: First Battle of the Marne
events.description: French and British forces halt the German advance on Paris, ending hopes of a quick German victory and beginning trench warfare.

events.title: First Battle of Ypres
events.description: German forces attempt to capture Ypres in Belgium. The battle ends in stalemate and establishes the Western Front trench lines.

events.title: Gallipoli Campaign
events.description: Allied attempt to capture Constantinople fails after months of brutal fighting. Over 500,000 casualties on both sides.

events.title: First Use of Poison Gas
events.description: Germany uses chlorine gas at the Second Battle of Ypres, marking the first large-scale use of chemical weapons in warfare.

events.title: Sinking of the Lusitania
events.description: German U-boat sinks the British passenger liner RMS Lusitania, killing 1,198 including 128 Americans, shifting US public opinion.

events.title: Battle of Verdun
events.description: One of the longest and bloodiest battles in history. German offensive against French positions results in over 700,000 combined casualties.

events.title: Battle of Jutland
events.description: Largest naval battle of WWI between British Royal Navy and German High Seas Fleet. Tactically inconclusive but strategic British victory.

events.title: Battle of the Somme
events.description: British and French offensive. First day sees 57,470 British casualties, the bloodiest day in British military history. Over 1 million total casualties.

events.title: First Use of Tanks
events.description: British forces deploy tanks for the first time in battle during the Somme offensive, introducing a new era of mechanized warfare.

events.title: Germany Resumes Unrestricted Submarine Warfare
events.description: Germany announces resumption of unrestricted submarine warfare, sinking any ship in the war zone without warning.

events.title: February Revolution in Russia
events.description: Popular uprising in Petrograd leads to abdication of Tsar Nicholas II and establishment of provisional government.

events.title: United States Enters WWI
events.description: US Congress declares war on Germany following unrestricted submarine warfare and the Zimmermann Telegram.

events.title: Battle of Arras
events.description: British offensive in northern France. Initial success at Vimy Ridge but overall gains are limited.

events.title: Third Battle of Ypres (Passchendaele)
events.description: British offensive in Flanders. Fought in terrible mud, results in approximately 500,000 combined casualties for minimal territorial gain.

events.title: October Revolution in Russia
events.description: Bolsheviks led by Vladimir Lenin seize power in Petrograd, beginning the Russian Civil War and eventual Soviet state.

events.title: Battle of Cambrai
events.description: First large-scale use of tanks in a combined arms offensive. Initial breakthrough but gains later reversed by German counterattack.

events.title: Wilson's Fourteen Points
events.description: President Woodrow Wilson outlines his vision for post-war peace, including self-determination and a League of Nations.

events.title: Treaty of Brest-Litovsk
events.description: Soviet Russia signs peace treaty with Central Powers, ending Russian participation in WWI and ceding vast territories.

events.title: German Spring Offensive
events.description: Germany's final major offensive on the Western Front. Initial gains but ultimately fails to achieve decisive breakthrough.

events.title: Battle of Cantigny
events.description: First major American offensive of the war. US 1st Division captures the village of Cantigny, demonstrating American combat capability.

events.title: Second Battle of the Marne
events.description: Last major German offensive fails. Allied counterattack marks turning point; Germany now on defensive for remainder of war.

events.title: Hundred Days Offensive
events.description: Final Allied offensive that leads to German defeat. Series of victories that break through German lines and end the war.

events.title: Meuse-Argonne Offensive
events.description: Largest American military operation in history to that point. 1.2 million American soldiers participate, suffering 120,000+ casualties.

events.title: Kaiser Wilhelm II Abdicates
events.description: German Kaiser Wilhelm II abdicates the throne and flees to the Netherlands. Germany is declared a republic.

events.title: Armistice Signed - WWI Ends
events.description: Armistice signed at 5:00 AM, taking effect at 11:00 AM. The 'war to end all wars' concludes with over 17 million dead.

events.title: Paris Peace Conference
events.description: Allied leaders meet to negotiate peace terms. The 'Big Four' - Wilson, Lloyd George, Clemenceau, and Orlando - shape post-war world.

events.title: Treaty of Versailles Signed
events.description: Germany signs Treaty of Versailles, accepting war guilt, territorial losses, military restrictions, and reparations. Seeds of WWII planted.

events.title: League of Nations Established
events.description: First international organization for maintaining world peace begins operation. US Senate refuses to join.

events.title: 19th Amendment Ratified
events.description: Women gain the right to vote in the United States after decades of suffrage movement activism.

events.title: The Roaring Twenties
events.description: Period of economic prosperity and cultural dynamism in Western societies, characterized by jazz, flappers, and rapid industrialization.

events.title: Mussolini's March on Rome
events.description: Benito Mussolini and his Fascist Party march on Rome. King Victor Emmanuel III appoints Mussolini Prime Minister of Italy.

events.title: Beer Hall Putsch
events.description: Adolf Hitler attempts to seize power in Munich. The coup fails and Hitler is imprisoned, where he writes Mein Kampf.

events.title: Death of Vladimir Lenin
events.description: Soviet leader Vladimir Lenin dies, leading to power struggle eventually won by Joseph Stalin.

events.title: Lindbergh Crosses Atlantic
events.description: Charles Lindbergh completes first solo non-stop transatlantic flight in the Spirit of St. Louis.

events.title: Black Thursday
events.description: Stock market begins to crash on the New York Stock Exchange. Investors trade 12.9 million shares in panic selling.

events.title: Black Tuesday - Stock Market Crash
events.description: Stock market collapses as 16 million shares are traded. Billions of dollars lost, triggering the Great Depression worldwide.

events.title: The Great Depression
events.description: Worst economic downturn in modern history. Global GDP falls by 15%, unemployment reaches 25% in US, widespread poverty and suffering.

events.title: Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act
events.description: US enacts protective tariffs on over 20,000 imported goods. Retaliatory tariffs worldwide worsen the Depression.

events.title: Creditanstalt Bank Collapses
events.description: Austria's largest bank fails, triggering banking crises across Central Europe and deepening the global depression.

events.title: Japan Invades Manchuria
events.description: Japanese forces seize Manchuria following the staged Mukden Incident. League of Nations condemns but takes no action.

events.title: Bonus Army Dispersed
events.description: US Army forcibly evicts 43,000 WWI veterans from Washington D.C. who were demanding early payment of service bonuses.

events.title: FDR Elected President
events.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt defeats Herbert Hoover in landslide victory, promising a 'New Deal' for Americans.

events.title: Hitler Becomes Chancellor of Germany
events.description: Adolf Hitler is appointed Chancellor of Germany by President Hindenburg. Beginning of Nazi regime.

events.title: Reichstag Fire
events.description: German parliament building burns. Nazis blame Communists and use the crisis to consolidate power.

events.title: FDR Inaugurated
events.description: Roosevelt delivers famous 'The only thing we have to fear is fear itself' speech and begins New Deal programs.

events.title: First Hundred Days
events.description: FDR's first hundred days see unprecedented legislative action: Emergency Banking Act, CCC, AAA, TVA, NIRA, and more.

events.title: Dachau Concentration Camp Opens
events.description: First Nazi concentration camp opens near Munich, initially for political prisoners. Model for later death camps.

events.title: Enabling Act Passed
events.description: German parliament passes law giving Hitler dictatorial powers, effectively ending the Weimar Republic.

events.title: Prohibition Repealed
events.description: 21st Amendment ratified, ending the 13-year prohibition on alcohol in the United States.

events.title: Night of the Long Knives
events.description: Hitler purges the SA leadership, including Ernst Röhm. At least 85 killed as Hitler consolidates power.

events.title: Hitler Becomes Führer
events.description: Following President Hindenburg's death, Hitler combines offices of President and Chancellor, becoming absolute dictator.

events.title: Germany Rejects Versailles Treaty
events.description: Hitler announces rearmament and reintroduction of conscription, openly violating the Treaty of Versailles.

events.title: Social Security Act Signed
events.description: FDR signs Social Security Act, establishing retirement benefits, unemployment insurance, and aid to dependent children.

events.title: Nuremberg Laws Enacted
events.description: Nazi Germany passes anti-Semitic laws stripping Jews of citizenship and forbidding marriage with non-Jews.

events.title: Italy Invades Ethiopia
events.description: Mussolini's Italy invades Ethiopia. League of Nations sanctions prove ineffective.

events.title: Germany Remilitarizes Rhineland
events.description: German troops enter the demilitarized Rhineland. France and Britain protest but take no action.

events.title: Spanish Civil War
events.description: Nationalist forces under Franco, aided by Germany and Italy, fight Republican government. Prelude to WWII with 500,000 dead.

events.title: Rome-Berlin Axis Formed
events.description: Germany and Italy sign treaty of friendship, forming the Axis alliance that would later include Japan.

events.title: Hindenburg Disaster
events.description: German airship Hindenburg explodes while landing in New Jersey, killing 36 and ending the era of passenger airships.

events.title: Second Sino-Japanese War Begins
events.description: Japan invades China proper following the Marco Polo Bridge Incident. Beginning of WWII in Asia.

events.title: Rape of Nanking
events.description: Japanese forces capture Nanking (Nanjing). Mass murder, rape, and looting kill an estimated 200,000-300,000 Chinese civilians.

events.title: Anschluss - Germany Annexes Austria
events.description: German troops enter Austria, which is incorporated into the Third Reich. Britain and France protest but do not intervene.

events.title: Munich Agreement Signed
events.description: Britain, France, Germany, and Italy agree to German annexation of Sudetenland. Chamberlain declares 'peace for our time.'

events.title: Kristallnacht (Night of Broken Glass)
events.description: Nazi-organized pogrom against Jews throughout Germany and Austria. 91 killed, 30,000 sent to concentration camps, 7,500 businesses destroyed.

events.title: Germany Occupies Czechoslovakia
events.description: Germany occupies remainder of Czechoslovakia, violating Munich Agreement and proving appeasement has failed.

events.title: Nazi-Soviet Pact Signed
events.description: Germany and Soviet Union sign non-aggression pact with secret protocol dividing Eastern Europe between them.

events.title: Germany Invades Poland - WWII Begins
events.description: German forces launch blitzkrieg against Poland without declaration of war. World War II in Europe begins.

events.title: World War II
events.description: Deadliest conflict in human history. Involves over 30 countries and results in 70-85 million deaths including the Holocaust.

events.title: Britain and France Declare War on Germany
events.description: Honoring their treaty obligations to Poland, Britain and France declare war on Germany.

events.title: Soviet Union Invades Poland
events.description: Soviet forces invade eastern Poland per the secret Nazi-Soviet pact. Poland partitioned between Germany and USSR.

events.title: Winter War
events.description: Soviet Union invades Finland. Despite initial Finnish successes, peace treaty cedes territory to USSR.

events.title: German Invasion of Denmark and Norway
events.description: Germany launches surprise invasion. Denmark falls in hours; Norway fights for two months before surrendering.

events.title: Winston Churchill Becomes Prime Minister
events.description: Churchill replaces Neville Chamberlain as British PM, promising 'blood, toil, tears and sweat.'

events.title: Fall of France
events.description: Germany invades France through Belgium and the Ardennes, bypassing Maginot Line. France surrenders in 6 weeks.

events.title: Dunkirk Evacuation
events.description: Operation Dynamo evacuates 338,000 Allied troops from beaches of Dunkirk. 'Miracle of the little ships.'

events.title: France Signs Armistice with Germany
events.description: France surrenders. Northern France occupied; Vichy government established in south under German supervision.

events.title: Battle of Britain
events.description: German Luftwaffe attempts to gain air superiority over Britain. RAF victory prevents German invasion. 'Never was so much owed by so many to so few.'

events.title: The Blitz
events.description: German bombing campaign against British cities. London bombed for 57 consecutive nights. Over 43,000 civilians killed.

events.title: Tripartite Pact Signed
events.description: Germany, Italy, and Japan sign military alliance, formally creating the Axis powers.

events.title: Lend-Lease Act Signed
events.description: FDR signs act allowing US to supply weapons to Britain and other allies. US becomes 'arsenal of democracy.'

events.title: Invasion of Yugoslavia and Greece
events.description: Germany invades Balkans to secure southern flank before attacking USSR. Both countries fall within weeks.

events.title: Bismarck Sunk
events.description: German battleship Bismarck, the most powerful warship in the Atlantic, is sunk by British Royal Navy after epic chase.

events.title: Operation Barbarossa Begins
events.description: Germany launches largest military operation in history, invading Soviet Union with 3.8 million troops on a 2,900 km front.

events.title: Eastern Front
events.description: War between Nazi Germany and Soviet Union. Deadliest theater of WWII with over 30 million military and civilian deaths.

events.title: Atlantic Charter Signed
events.description: FDR and Churchill issue joint declaration of war aims, laying groundwork for United Nations and post-war order.

events.title: Siege of Leningrad
events.description: German and Finnish forces besiege Leningrad for 872 days. Over 1 million civilians die, mostly from starvation.

events.title: Battle of Moscow
events.description: German offensive to capture Soviet capital. Soviet counteroffensive pushes Germans back, ending hope of quick victory.

events.title: Attack on Pearl Harbor
events.description: Japan launches surprise attack on US Pacific Fleet at Pearl Harbor. 2,403 Americans killed. 'A date which will live in infamy.'

events.title: United States Declares War on Japan
events.description: Congress declares war on Japan with only one dissenting vote. US fully enters World War II.

events.title: Germany and Italy Declare War on US
events.description: Hitler and Mussolini declare war on the United States. US now fighting on two fronts.

events.title: Wannsee Conference
events.description: Nazi officials meet to coordinate the 'Final Solution' - the systematic genocide of European Jews.

events.title: Japanese-American Internment Begins
events.description: FDR signs Executive Order 9066 authorizing internment of 120,000 Japanese Americans in concentration camps.

events.title: Doolittle Raid
events.description: US B-25 bombers raid Tokyo from aircraft carrier. Minimal damage but major morale boost for America.

events.title: Battle of the Coral Sea
events.description: First naval battle fought entirely by aircraft. Japanese advance on Port Moresby halted. Tactical draw but strategic Allied victory.

events.title: Battle of Midway
events.description: Turning point of Pacific War. US sinks four Japanese carriers, ending Japanese naval superiority.

events.title: Battle of Guadalcanal
events.description: First major Allied offensive in Pacific. After six months of brutal fighting, Japan withdraws from the island.

events.title: Battle of Stalingrad
events.description: Bloodiest battle in human history. Soviet victory destroys German 6th Army. Turning point of the Eastern Front.

events.title: Second Battle of El Alamein
events.description: British victory in Egypt turns tide in North Africa. Montgomery defeats Rommel's Afrika Korps.

events.title: Operation Torch
events.description: Allied invasion of French North Africa. First major Anglo-American ground operation in European theater.

events.title: Casablanca Conference
events.description: FDR and Churchill meet and announce policy of 'unconditional surrender' for Axis powers.

events.title: Warsaw Ghetto Uprising
events.description: Jewish resistance fighters in Warsaw Ghetto revolt against Nazi deportations. Brutally suppressed after nearly a month.

events.title: Axis Forces Surrender in North Africa
events.description: Over 275,000 Axis troops surrender in Tunisia, ending the North African campaign.

events.title: Battle of Kursk
events.description: Largest tank battle in history. Soviet victory ends German offensive capability on Eastern Front.

events.title: Allied Invasion of Sicily
events.description: Operation Husky lands Allied forces in Sicily, first invasion of Axis territory in Europe.

events.title: Mussolini Deposed
events.description: Italian Fascist Grand Council votes to remove Mussolini from power. He is arrested on King's orders.

events.title: Italy Surrenders
events.description: Italy signs armistice with Allies. Germany immediately occupies northern Italy.

events.title: Italian Campaign
events.description: Allied forces fight up Italian peninsula against German defenders. Brutal mountain warfare continues until war's end.

events.title: Tehran Conference
events.description: First meeting of 'Big Three' - FDR, Churchill, Stalin. Agree on Operation Overlord and Soviet offensive.

events.title: Battle of Anzio
events.description: Allied amphibious landing south of Rome becomes bogged down for four months before breakout.

events.title: Liberation of Rome
events.description: Allied forces enter Rome, the first Axis capital to fall. Hitler orders German retreat.

events.title: D-Day - Normandy Invasion
events.description: Largest amphibious invasion in history. 156,000 Allied troops land on five beaches in Normandy, France.

events.title: Battle of Normandy
events.description: Allied forces break out from beachheads and liberate northern France. Over 425,000 Allied and German casualties.

events.title: Battle of Saipan
events.description: US captures Saipan in the Marianas, providing base for B-29 bombers to reach Japan.

events.title: Battle of the Philippine Sea
events.description: 'Great Marianas Turkey Shoot' - US destroys Japanese naval aviation, sinking 3 carriers and 600+ aircraft.

events.title: Operation Bagration
events.description: Massive Soviet offensive destroys German Army Group Center. 400,000+ German casualties, liberation of Belarus.

events.title: July 20 Plot Against Hitler
events.description: German officers attempt to assassinate Hitler with bomb. Hitler survives; conspirators executed.

events.title: Warsaw Uprising
events.description: Polish Home Army rises against German occupation. Soviet forces halt at the Vistula as Germans crush revolt.

events.title: Operation Dragoon
events.description: Allied invasion of southern France. German forces retreat north to avoid encirclement.

events.title: Liberation of Paris
events.description: Free French forces and US 4th Infantry Division liberate Paris. De Gaulle leads victory parade.

events.title: Operation Market Garden
events.description: Bold Allied airborne operation to capture bridges in Netherlands fails at Arnhem. 'A bridge too far.'

events.title: Battle of Leyte Gulf
events.description: Largest naval battle in history. US destroys remaining Japanese naval power, liberates Philippines.

events.title: First Kamikaze Attacks
events.description: Japanese begin systematic suicide attacks against Allied ships in Battle of Leyte Gulf.

events.title: Battle of the Bulge
events.description: Germany's last major offensive in the West. Initial success but lacks fuel; 186,000 American casualties.

events.title: Vistula-Oder Offensive
events.description: Massive Soviet offensive advances from Poland to within 70 km of Berlin.

events.title: Liberation of Auschwitz
events.description: Soviet forces liberate Auschwitz concentration camp complex, finding evidence of mass murder of over 1 million Jews.

events.title: Yalta Conference
events.description: Big Three meet in Crimea. Agree on German occupation zones, UN, and Soviet entry into Pacific war.

events.title: Bombing of Dresden
events.description: Allied firebombing of Dresden kills 25,000+. Controversial attack on cultural city with disputed military value.

events.title: Battle of Iwo Jima
events.description: Marines capture strategic island after brutal fighting. Famous flag-raising photo. 6,800 Americans, 18,000 Japanese killed.

events.title: Firebombing of Tokyo
events.description: Most destructive bombing raid in history. 100,000+ killed, 16 square miles destroyed. More deadly than atomic bombs.

events.title: Battle of Okinawa
events.description: Last and bloodiest Pacific island battle. 12,000 Americans, 110,000 Japanese soldiers, and 150,000 civilians killed.

events.title: Death of Franklin D. Roosevelt
events.description: FDR dies of cerebral hemorrhage in Warm Springs, Georgia. Harry S. Truman becomes president.

events.title: Battle of Berlin
events.description: Final major offensive of the European war. Soviet forces encircle and capture German capital.

events.title: US and Soviet Forces Meet at Elbe
events.description: American and Soviet troops meet at Torgau on the Elbe River, cutting Germany in two.

events.title: Mussolini Executed
events.description: Italian partisans capture and execute Mussolini and his mistress. Bodies hung in Milan's Piazzale Loreto.

events.title: Hitler Commits Suicide
events.description: Adolf Hitler commits suicide in his Berlin bunker as Soviet forces close in. Eva Braun dies with him.

events.title: Germany Surrenders at Reims
events.description: General Jodl signs unconditional surrender at Eisenhower's headquarters in Reims, France.

events.title: V-E Day - Victory in Europe
events.description: War in Europe officially ends. Celebrations worldwide as Germany surrenders unconditionally.

events.title: Trinity Test - First Atomic Bomb
events.description: US successfully tests first atomic bomb at Alamogordo, New Mexico. Dawn of nuclear age.

events.title: Potsdam Conference
events.description: Final Big Three conference. Truman, Stalin, Churchill (later Attlee) discuss post-war order and ultimatum to Japan.

events.title: Atomic Bomb Dropped on Hiroshima
events.description: B-29 'Enola Gay' drops 'Little Boy' on Hiroshima. Approximately 80,000 killed instantly, 140,000 by year's end.

events.title: Soviet Union Declares War on Japan
events.description: USSR declares war on Japan and invades Manchuria with 1.6 million troops.

events.title: Atomic Bomb Dropped on Nagasaki
events.description: B-29 'Bockscar' drops 'Fat Man' on Nagasaki. Approximately 40,000 killed instantly, 70,000 by year's end.

events.title: Japan Announces Surrender
events.description: Emperor Hirohito broadcasts announcement of Japan's surrender. V-J Day celebrations begin worldwide.

events.title: Japan Signs Surrender - WWII Ends
events.description: Japanese officials sign formal surrender aboard USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay. World War II officially ends.

events.title: United Nations Established
events.description: UN Charter enters into force. New international organization aims to prevent future world wars.

events.title: Nuremberg Trials
events.description: Major war criminals tried before International Military Tribunal. 12 sentenced to death for crimes against humanity.
